Articles.Content:
Hey, can someone tell me what this is? (see in attachment)

This black thing is in every flight in my terrain and my world... It\'s a little bit creepy... I show it you in a perfect position, because I wasn\'t in the near of it.

> 
> Hey, can someone tell me what this is? (see in attachment)
> 
> This black thing is in every flight in my terrain and my world... It\'s a little bit creepy... I show it you in a perfect position, because I wasn\'t in the near of it.

It is a monolith - Squad put a few of them on the surface of Kerbin and the Mun for players to find.

Woooow... ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)

That\'s very interesting... What stands there on the monolit?

> 
> Woooow... ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)
> 
> That\'s very interesting... What stands there on the monolit?

You mean what is written on it? It is the squad logo...

![200px-Squad_Logo.png](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/~kerbalsp/wiki/images/thumb/f/f7/Squad_Logo.png/200px-Squad_Logo.png)

> 
> Woooow... ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png)
> 
> That\'s very interesting... What stands there on the monolit?

The Squad logo, as Awaras said. Why is this in a dev log thread?

Oh, excuse me. I don\'t like it to make new topics, so I search about other topics...

Excuse me because my enlish is so bad.

Aye, it\'s a monolith.

> 
> There are several of them around Kerbin, and the Mun as well.
> 
> The Kerbals seem to have been quite slow on the evolutionary get-go, because it sure took a lot of monoliths to get them up to speed. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) 

Cheers
I could\'ve sworn that their name was Munolith...
Munolith, because Nova found the first one on the Mun. But if Harv says monolith then it is monolith.

> 
> I could\'ve sworn that their name was Munolith...

Yah. I guess Harv is wrong. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Actually, I think he just doesn\'t mind whatever we call them. I\'ve been calling them Munar Muonic Anomalies, and Kerbal Muonic Anomalies, but nobody else does. You\'re all wrong. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> I could\'ve sworn that their name was Munolith...

A Munolith needs to be on the Mun to make sense. Given that there are similar objects at Kerbin as well, I\'d say they\'re regular monoliths. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Cheers
Mun rockets don\'t need a Mun to fail, so Munoliths whouldn\'t need a Mun to exist, right?

Kerbolith, Munolith, Monolith. As long as we know what we\'re talking about...

> The Kerbals seem to have been quite slow on the evolutionary get-go, because it sure took a lot of monoliths to get them up to speed. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Apparently with enough monoliths, even grass can have a space program? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Harvester, you should put KSC back on the mun, Even if it was a bug! ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Apparently with enough monoliths, even grass can have a space program? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Well, only one was enough to make monkeys to have their own, they\'re quite powerful. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) I wouldn\'t be suprised if with enough monoliths parameciums could become a spacefaring master-race.
Heh. Monoliths... well, that sure brings back memories of Spore... and I think they needed a few *too* many monoliths to get their space program underway... :/
